content:
14, 2013
												STALKER: Call of Pripyat (CoP)Another excellent installment in the STALKER series. I love these games - they succeed in combining FPS and RPG gameplay like no other. When pressed to describe the STALKER games, I find it easiest to explain them as "RPGs without all the fiddly bits." You have quests and inventory, but no stats and levels. There's no inflating abilities with experience points - everything you do, you do to move the game along, not to build a gold stash or level up for a boss fight.CoP is the most polished of the three STALKER games. Not easier, though - combat is still challenging, and ammo scarce. But the quests are more linear, with fewer distractions as you move through the story. I approve of that streamlining, as CoP has more story to tell than the other two games. Total game time here is the same as the others... roughly 30 hours, give or take, depending on how much you choose to accomplish.Why I enjoy the STALKER series so much is that they delver a plausible game world. When you explore, you will find distant locations that have no bearing on the game's story, yet are meticulously crafted. Unlike most RPGs, you don't feel like the center of the universe. Instead, you feel like a visitor to a world that has been there before you arrived, and will continue after you leave. And dangerous! Here is a game where you stay on the roads, and seek shelter at night. A game where a pack of wild dogs is actually as dangerous as it should be. Each NPC has a name, and goes about his own life in the Zone. CoP plays this to the extreme - when the game ends, you are treated to a slideshow that describes what becomes of roughly 20 NPCs that you will encounter through the game. For each character, his denoument is affected by your interaction with him. I found this very rewarding.My one gripe is that CoP plays down the faction wars that were such a big part of STALKER: Clear Sky. I missed picking sides between Freedom and Duty. But all of the familiar factions are present in this game. Freedom and Duty have reached an easy peace. Stalkers and Bandits are still two sides of the same coin. And Monolith is still a pain in the ♥♥♥♥.Yes, I do recommend this game. And as always, STALKER games are best with their accompanying "Complete" mod. These mods bring higher-quality graphics and sound, and excellent weather effects to the STALKER series, without changing the core game. They also minimize some of the repetitive NPC quotes you hear in the game. They are a must, even for first playthrough. Link: http://www.moddb.com/mods/call-of-pripyat-completeLooking forward to Survarium.... http://survarium.com/

												This is my opinion.S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is like an art to me. It really captured the sense of Russia in an apocalyptic stage. It has some open world elements to is with a very good story. It might seem a little old for the new gamers but once you get in to it than I’ll think they will share my vision. The coolest part of the staler series I think is the psy damage you can take. That moment there is some kind of anomaly that makes you insane, making you hear voices and makes you see things there aren’t there. And the emisions  make you feel like you have to outrun a nuclear explosion. next to that there are more kids of damages you could receive like burns, poison damage, bleeding damage, radiation, starvation, shock damage, Rupture (from mutants animals), and explosion damage.The mutants are quite scary and you can always hear them from a far adding to the horror element of the game. Some mutants turn invisible and become visible again once close to you trying to suck you blood. Other mutants try to control you brain. And that really makes me ♥♥♥♥ bricks.Call of Pripyat is one is one of the few series that S.T.A.L.K.E.R. has to offer. What I did miss in the game was the ability to join factions just like in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Clear sky. I really do recommend the game.

content:
r 7, 2015
												If you are searching for a great game, which offers a atmospheric and challeging trip to the outlands aswell as the crumbling structures of pripyat, your search has come to an end.I highly recommend playing this game with the misery mod, which is a complete overhaul of the main game. It deepens every aspect of the original STALKER CoP making it even better than it is. More weapons, more difficult gameplay, new game mechanics, better graphics, more usable items and even more.There are negativ aspects, like micro lags from time to time or unlikely crashes, but taking all before mentioned aspects into consideration, this game in combination with the misery mod is awesome. STALKER Call of Pripyat + Misery Mod is a "must-play"! and in my opínion highly underrated for what it is. A great game.

content:
, 2015
												This game is a hunk of junk with a Gem inside of it. Those who endure the stuttering and bugs (which in a way are iconic to the Stalker series) see why this game is beautiful in graphical fidelity and environment in an awe-inspiring post-apocalyptic landscape carved by the Chernobyl disaster.As far as vanilla gunplay is concerned, it is, to be honest, a bit meh. And the variety is just a bit lacking. Therefore, I strongly recommend getting the Arsenal Overhaul mod alongside Absolute Nature and Atmosfear.You can get that here: -----------> http://www.moddb.com/mods/arsenal-overhaulTo have the full Stalker experience, I recommend having headphones on as it is just so immersive.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
8, 2014
												I am so very torn by this game it's unreal. I can't love this game and yet I want to, I can't hate it and yet I want to. I suppose I was just so excited at the premise of an open world shooter set in Pripyat, the idea alone is worth so much and yet I find myself ambivalent. It's really fun to explore the dark, depressing but not tense world of post-Chernobyl Pripyat (and the outlying areas, you don't actually REACH Pripyat until much later) but it feels so sparse. I know you'd expect that sort of thing from an irradiated area but it feels like a few meagre locations interspersed with mostly identical grassland with the occasional swamp or trees or anomaly, it works from a canonical standpoint but I feel it cheapens the whole "open world" aspect. The almost utter lack of voice acting prbably wouldn't have bothered me so much except it makes it impossible to distinguish people. They have no personality of which to speak and whatever voice acting you DO get is at best okay (sometimes you can CLEARLY hear the same person switch between two different voice actors, one in English and one in Russian), I really feel as if the NPC's in this game are a serious impediment to the enjoyment of what is otherwise quite a fine game. Gunplay is a bit turgid, the guns don't really have much feeling to them and there's no real discernible differences in firepower within the same class of firearm. All the pistols are like peashooters to most enemies, shotguns are okay and so on, although I kind of liked the Gauss Rifle which brings me to another issue in the area of sound. Most of it is actually quite good, especially at night when it gets actually really atmospheric with rather haunting animal noises, crickets and a bit of fairly repetitive but good background music. But a lot of the audio sounds so uninspired and boring, especially gunfire (with particular note to the Gauss Rifle, it sounds terrible), item noises sometimes don't make sense and can get repetitive (although that is understandable). The ending was also really abrupt and very unsatisfactory. Yet despite its many failings this game has quite a bit to offer the discerning gamer, even if I can't quite elucidate my reasons for liking it. All I can say it's atmospheric, the world is pretty good looking if sparse and the concept of anomalies and stuff in Pripyat is interesting and quite engaging. This game might not live up to its potential but it is worth your time. I sincerely hope they get some experienced devs to make the sequel this IP deserves.EDIT: I suppose in retrospect this review looked quite negative, but this is a really engrossing game at times and the fact that there's no hand holding or explanation of which to speak means that it's on you to figure everything out and that's always a plus for immersion. If it's ever on sale do buy this game, for all its flaws it is still a good game.

content:
ry 21, 2014
												now this wont be a full reveiw upon first writing but im going over the baisics of what i want to say ( becuase ive got a dam lot to say about this game i mean look at this intro :D )The S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Series as always been my favourite series of games for a number of reasons, whether it is the crazy amount of weird and wonderful guns, suits and items, or the weird and whacky storyline, i love almost everything about this game , and i will say why now.Story:one of my favourite parts about the stalker games is the story lines that always seem to have a big twist at the end or something like that. Anyway, the story in CoP is really quite cool how they made it all play out, one of the best bits is being able to see how you affected every other stalkers life while you were in the zone at the end of the game with about 20 or so slides telling you about what happend after you left the zone.Weaponry:With a decent selection of weaponry for all play styles, this game can make you play through it many times just so you can play around with the guns and ammo types ( two for each gun except the PKM, Sniper rifles and the RPG ). from shotguns to expermental gaus rifles, this game unmodded provided me with atleast 70 hours before i even thought about modding it.Suits / Armour:Stalker has system whereby you can wear suits that affect your carry weight, protection for various envriomental hazards, gunfire and can effect your mobility. CoP by far offers the most diverse Suit system by allowing the player to (with most suits) mix and match head gear and main body suits depending on your play style, (gas masks for artifact hunters, military helmets for combat, and high-end mixes of both). There is a massive variety of upgrades that can completley changes the suits performance (Servos on an exoskeleton, alloying you to sprint).Upgrading your equipment:CoP allows you to collect tool kits and gie them to technicians, who will reward you with the ability to upgrade your guns and suits more (and a small cash reward). You can turn a AK-74 into a laser fast firing assault cannon, or make it a more accurate mid range sniper.still wip

content:
y 1, 2011
												It doesn't have quite the oppressive, loner atmosphere that characterized the first game, but mods (in particular, Misery) easily fill in that void. This game has three very large open areas to explore and a great deal of handcrafted, well-scripted quests as opposed to the endlessly generated "go here, fetch that" quests that were the daily fare of the previous two games.The overall plot arc isn't as interesting as its predecessors, but it does reference them well. It also has several endings, Fallout slideshow style, based upon your involvement throughout the game, which lends towards a satisfying conclusion and encourages replayability. Call of Pripyat is the culmination of the systems introduced in the previous two games - setting, gameplay mechanics, and introduces an extra layer of attention to detail and care that pushes it above its predecessors.\I'd call it the most complete S.T.A.L.K.E.R. experience. If you play only one of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games, pick this one.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
17, 2014
												An atmospheric shooter based in the aftermath of the nuclear catastrophe in Chernobyl, with the slight twist of mutants, lethal anomalies, warring factions and other delightful treats. The combat with humans involves high damage, bullet drop and cover to cover stressful gun battles. Mutants meanwhile, require a certain level of awareness and responsiveness as the different mutants require adapting tactics with haste. The game also includes survival elments such as hunger, radiation and the like. Exploration plays a key role in getting equipment to survive the various trials the game throws at you, as does interaction with the various factions. The graphics are a bit dated, but there are mods to deal with that, and if you find the game too easy, there are also mods to tweak the difficulty to provide a more challenging, rewording experience. Overall, 8/8.

content:
8, 2015
												--This is a neutral review from someone who is not familiar with the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series--S.T.A.L.K.E.R is a series I really want to get into because the community isn't stupid and the game looks damn good but the older S.T.A.L.K.E.R games are a bit to old for my liking so I got this one becuase its the latest.Now I tried to get into this game, I really did but Christicle on a bicycle this is hard, the game gives you a little bit of backstory and then dumps you in a field. This appears to be one of those games that you learn about the hard way, for example every now and then something called an Emission explodes across the whole map and wipes out everyone, I found myself getting killed over and over again by the first Emission until I eventually gave up and Googled it, I discovered that you have to hide underground in order to escape it...I guess this is just the cruel nature of this game because it gives you little to no information on anything, not even the basic mechanics are revealed to you and you have to study up everything just like Dark Souls.The atmosphere in this game is astonishing and I have never seen a game come even close to the dark, creepy and radioactive atmosphere that this game has, I spent most of my time too afriad to enter buildings because of the various sanity destroying sounds coming out of them.S.T.A.L.K.E.R: Call of Pripyat is a game I really want to get into but the difficulty and various mechanics that I know nothing about keeps scaring me away from it. Some people say that this game is a Fallout 3 ripoff and I find that really offensive because the developers must of worked really hard on this game and I feel like they didn't get the respect/money that they deserved because this game is different and somewhat ahead of its time.Now get out of here Stalker!

												I mean, i tried 2 times to play this game but i never got hooked and left it gaining dust. But the 3rd time.. oh boi. Summer vacations give me a lot of free time to test new games, so i gave STALKER one last chance. The controls are jerky and your head seems on a permanent rollercoaster, the combat system is god-awful with outdated animations. The characters look all the same, no female characters, 3+1 models per faction, the cutscenes are cringy and out of sync. But this game has that cheeki breeki feeling that brings you memories that you never felt before. I gave up on life and lived the life of a artifact hunter in 1 silly game.Buy it on sale

content:
y 9, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat could best be described as a mixture between Fallout, Metro 2033, and a touch of Mount and Blade. This game does not hold your hand, you are thrusted into the chaotic world of post-apocalyptic Russia with no tutorials or even goals given. It is easy enough to figure out how to follow the main quest, and side missions aren't revealed with an exclamation point over the quest-giver's head. The gunplay is surprisingly impressive as your weapons will break the more you shoot. Enemies are somewhat creative though they can become an annoyance as they are sometimes tough to shoot. But all in all, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is definitely worth a try.

content:
4, 2016
												When I first got my PC I had a list of games I wanted to try out, but none of them were from the stalker series. Infact I hadnt even heard of these games until one day I was exploring the store and this little gem caught my eye. What almost immediately stuck out to me was the review score being overwhelmingly positive. After seeing that I read some reviews, watched some gameplay and eventually it came down to either this game or Half Life (The Original) and in the end i choose this game but its hard start had turned me off of it in the beginning so i let it sit for a while. Fast forward to a random boring day when it was raining and no internet connection and i gave it another go. I couldnt have made a better decision that day. On top of some nail bitting gameplay and fun exploration this game is one of the most immersive experinces I've ever had while playing a video game which wasn't even apperent till my brother had come to get my attention and when he tapped my shoulder i nearly ♥♥♥♥♥♥ my self. But I dont want wasste anymore time making people read this so  the negatives:-Emissions are annoyiong and kinda pointless-Having to travel from one zone to another just to access a stash, also very annoying.-the game has a learning curve in the beginning, but once you get passed it, the game can get pretty easy.- the story also is kinda none exsistent, but on the flip side to that the factions are interesting and have some pretty cool interactions in the world.positives:-really fun combat and survival mechanics.-interesting world with some deep rooted lore, but it can be a little vague on the details (and not in a fun dark souls way).-Focus on exploration that keeps the player on thier toes.-Fun quests that dont get boring even the fetch quests felt less like a chore and more like and objective.-one of the most immersive experiences ive ever had (Though Headphones or earbudds may have helped that a lot).Overall even with the list of negative things they end up being just some minor complaints in the end and they are pretty easy to get over but if you have at all had any intrest in the game or simply just wanted to have something to get away from the crappier games coming out now  I HIGHLY recomend you give this game a try it has been an amazing joy ride for me.

												I have more than the 50 or so hours that Steam claims I have. I can tell you it's closer to 300. This game is my Skyrim!The S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series is by far my favorite franchise of all-time. With everything the modding community has done, it's not hard to fall back in love with this game. An open world survival horror shooter... It doesn't get any better than that! If a first time PC gamer came to me and asked me for a recommendation for a PC exclusive, this is the game I would tell them to play. While it may be slightly clunky, the atmosphere, the gun play, the creatures, the story, and the mechanics are perfected. Play this game with mods like: Atmosfear [Detailed weather storms(This blows Fallout 4's weather out of the water)], Complete mod (graphics overhaul), Arsenal Overhaul (100+ Nato, RU weapons, and realistic damage), and MISERY (hardcore Dark Souls mode). The game will not disappoint.Rating:96/100

content:
0, 2015
												Arguably this is the best of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series, either this or clear sky. Clear sky is longer, but more flawed.  This game is shorter, and is only 3 areas (really, REALLY big areas), but the game feels more alive.  The quests are better overall, and for once you get to form a group of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.s, although only for one mission (nothing like the zombie mission from Clear Sky).  The mutants are scarier than ever, and the new chimera is a fearsome beast.  The origins of the monolith faction are finally clearly explained (although clever players knew what was up already).  If you haven't beaten clear sky then the true origins of the zone will remain a mystery to you in this game, with a cursory intro and a couple of dialogue options here and there being your only explanation (although it is not at all central to the plot).  The plot is fairly weak, but fun so it doesn't really matter.  what is really good is the world crafting, it is really fun just running around collecting artifacts, hunting mutants, and completing misssions.  Collecting and upgrading different guns can also be really fun, but experienced players will quickly find some guns are Much better than others.  The atmosphere and sound is top notch, I highly recommend if you like environmental horror games and fps games.

content:
26, 2016
												It is a good, survival horror, first person shooter that aims to drop casual gameplay for an intelligent, hardcore challenge which requires a change of play style. The AI is intelligent (sometimes a bit  too  intelligent), the enemies are tough, and the game has a controllable, rewarding, pace.It is only 7 years old at the time of this writing, but the graphics seem a bit older. Although if you enjoy games for what they truly are, this won't bother you. This game was the last installment in its series a few signs of rushing were shown. The previous game had better graphics (although horrendous shooting mechanics) and the sights are misaligned on many guns. This isn't a problem though, as  many  mods are available (almost all of them fixing this issue). Other than that, I can say this was perfected for the type of game it was when it was first made.Coming back to mods, you may notice that this game, out of three part series it's in, probably has the most mods of all. Almost all of them great (I personally prefer Misery) and provide fixes, tweaks, and improvements. From simple things such as the ballistics, to full-scale modifications ( Some even including the story! ).I really suggest that you read up some non-spoiler info on the game before starting it, as it provides no hand-holding tutorial or hints throughout itself.This info may be a bit bias, but in my honest opinion this is one of the greatest games I have ever played.

ry 22, 2014
												Call of Pripyat's a brilliant game that's definitely worth the 20 someodd hours it takes to beat it. It's an often intense, very dangerous shooter that actually forces you to use your head and pay attention to the game. Every enemy is incredibly dangerous, and the details are all quite well thought out. The game is also completely gorgeous and feels pleasant. You have a ton of freedom to pursue any and every goal at your whim, as you're dropped into Ukraine with nothing but a map, a mission, and some basic gear. There are plenty of ways to deal with your problems, and plenty of actually worthwhile challenges to take on. All done and bored with this game? There are a ton of mods to look into, most notably being MISERY. I haven't tried that as of yet though. Definitely worth a gander considering the price.

content:
4, 2011
												Do you like S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, but hate all the crashes, the inability to repair items, the wonky bugs, repetitive quests, the generally random-yet-static game world, unbalanced trade system, semi-useless factions, unintelligible story, confided customization system and the frequent loading screens? Call of Pripyat fixes all these problems admirably and delivers a far more focused and streamlined version of what is already my favorite PC game. While it's not quite as "Special" as the original, CoP is a superior game in almost every way when compared to its predecessor. The game is as stable as a brick house, the upgrade system is simple yet satisfying and worthwhile, the story is more involving and fleshed out, and while several quests do repeat, their only purpose is to fatten up your wallet which, thanks to the rebalanced economy, is entirely optional (no more 200000 RU Exoskeleton!). Furthermore, your actions really do seem to bring a measure of change to the Zone.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat:S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is a sequel to S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow Of Chernobyl, but has very little to do with the prequel except for the gameplay similarities and that they both are located in ''The Zone'' which is the irradiated area  surrounding the nuclear power plant Chernobyl and the city of Pripyat in Ukraine, needless to say, other than that the whole scenario is fictional. S.T.A.L.K.E.R is a Horror/Survival FP Shooter game developed by GSC Game World.General Information and story:You start as an USS Major Degtyarev and you are sent in to ''The Zone'' to investigate a failed operation called ''Operation Fairway''. This operation was planned to take the the Chernobyl NPP by force from the current forces holding it known only by the name ''Monolith''. The operation was a failure and all the stingray helicopters crashed in a suspicious way. So there you  are and you're mission is clear, but as you advance in the story it gets everything but clear, the pilots that are dead or killed all died in an extraordinary way except for those who died by the impact of the crashing helicopter, and some of the helicopters appear to be disfuctional even before they hit the ground. You're mission is a solo effort to find out why Operation Fairway was a failure, but as you progress through The Zone you have to work among the local stalkers which are the people wondering around and exploring The Zone brought there by various reasons. You may choose to work alongside the stalkers or rob them as a bandit either way you will have buddies. Stalkers make the most money, which is a luxury in The Zone, by hunting Artifacts which are items formed in an anomalous area, after getting artifacts they sell them to traders who trade them to the outside world. Artifacts have strange abilities like healing abilities. The Zone is a strange and dangerous place which makes the majors mission anything but easy. The Zone is full of dangerous anomalies, radiation, bandits, madmen, criminals and even mutated animals and people!You're mission leads you to the center of The Zone to city of Pripyat where you meet up with the remaining soldiers from Operation Fairway, There you can choose to do something about the Monolith and soon find out more about how the helicopters crashed. As it turns out the monolith have a secret weapon which works with electric energy from artifacts and uses batteries for ''magazines'' the weapon is called Gauss Rifle and the helicopters were shot down. in the end you are given a option to leave The Zone or to find out more about the Gauss Rifle and the Monolith or about The Zone, so the story is only so good how mutch time you put in to it. Like any other game you can just rush it out or take time with it and S.T.A.L.K.E.R is one where you should totally invest some time otherwise it's easily looked over because of it's graphical issues and it's cheap look, but the truth is S.T.A.L.K.E.R is anything but cheap! It may lack a perfect story but the atmosphere and feel is like any other, S.T.A.L.K.E.R has many intersting side missions and stories and the fact that it loosely is related to reality and has a realistic feel to it makes it an unmatched expirience in this kind of genre. Gameplay:Gameplay of S.T.A.L.K.E.R is very unique in my oppinion, it combines FPS gameplay with survival elements such as hunger and radiation sickness and the need to sleep with horror and even RPG elements such as simple stats, different weapons and armor, economy, side missions and exploring. Combined with the enviroment the gameplay fits like a glove even if it has a few downsides. The downsides are mostly minor things such as repeated lines from NPC's and buggy animations, other than that it's O.K. All in all the gameplay is something quite different from other compareable games and in a good way! S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat can attract fans of many genres. Multiplayer is nothing special, you're typical DM, TDM witch areas from the singleplayer.Graphics:The game was first released in 2009 so the graphics are a bit old but i wouldn't say that they look terrible, they aren't the diamond either there is a lot of room for improvement in here but especially in the animations. The game uses the X-Ray engine and has been updated to version 1.6 with DirectX 11. The games graphics can be enhanced with several mods that are avaliable through the web. I haven't found any major problems that mods have not been able to fix.Other:One thing that must be said about Call Of Pripyat is the large quantity of different mods that are avaliable, apparently S.T.A.L.K.E.R fans are loyal to game and have made a lot of great mods for people to play. Allmost every problem and aspect of the game can be fixed/enhanced with large or small mods. I recommend playing the game with one major mod before declaring it a piece of trash.Verdict:S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is  allmost a ground breaking title. Call Of Pripyat lacks the appearence to catch peoples eyes but is a beautyful game in many aspects. S.T.A.L.K.E.R in my oppinion has no problems the mods can't fix. All in all it is a refreshing title and a great expirience for a fan of any genre and has a feel and atmosphere like any other. Story is nothing special but keeps you interested to the end plus S.T.A.L.K.E.R has many great side missions. You can easily put 40 to 50 hours to this game and still not have played every little bit, depending on your difficulty and playstyle of course. S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call of Pripyat is excellent singleplayer expirience!9/10

er 4, 2013
												When you're going into The Zone, you know that you might not come back.  But if you do, you might just get rich.In the utter wasteland of Chernobyl things are getting worse.  And strange.  Mutants and monsters roam, the very laws of physics bend and break and the sky rains death in erruptions.  In this horrible place dubbed "The Zone",  military, rogue and secret factions war  for the secrets the zone is hiding.  Secrets that could free or end the world.STALKER Call of Pripyat is the finest in freeroaming wasteland adventure.  The non-scripted nature of this game will feed you a constant stream of emergent storytelling.  Don't miss this game.Also, read the wonderful Russian short story this series is based on called "Roadside Picnic", which is a free download somewhere.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ber 27, 2015
												The third STALKER game finds itself as the first one I played the entire way through. The polish is actually there, the guns are much improved. Mission design isn't actually bugged and the game can be much easier than previous entries. I much prefer to recommend it to others over the first two, because it follows a more Bethesda-RPG path and is a bit more open world, with 3 major maps and 6 contained zones. The meeting areas in the ship, train-station and laundramat bring back the whole comfort in numbers/fear in solitude dynamic that Clear Sky messed up on.Though, the broken messes of the original's demise seemed to suck a bit of the STALKER magic from the game. Every location is played out on the map and seems to all share a purpose, some more obvious than others. I wish loners would populate some of these areas after the threat has cleared, it sometimes feels some of these were just left fortotten.Duty & Freedom find themselves with reduced numbers, with control only over Yanov, so the large scale fights feel very toned down. Even in the game's third act in Pripyat I was really expecting some sort of large scale battle, because the shootouts in Pyripyat in ShoC or the assault on the Freedom HQ led themselves to some of the highlights in prior games. X-8 played situational horror more than anthing more subtle in prior labs, or the huge army of monolith in X-19The graphics are stunning in a very bizarre game. Its 6 years old and I've yet to see more involving shadow effects. Some may be technically more subtle but none actually change the enviornment as much. The new Chimera can be one scary ♥♥♥♥♥ to find out in the open.Well the third act was lined with disappointments the endgame of actual freeroam is a haven to players who loved the RPG aspects over all else, and they included enough of a threat to not suck the fun out of the game.9/10

ry 25, 2015
												I think that (without a shadow of a doubt) that this is the best game I have ever played. FACT. I've played many games both on PC and on console, but really the whole S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series is one of my favorite game series of all time. As soon as I bought the game and started playing it, I was in love with the game.I love how the game is EXTREMELY atmospheric. I think if it had Occulus Rift compatibility, I would definitely break some windows with my screams of terror. The AI is a little (ahem) crazy, but there are many modded overhauls for this game, such as MISERY, Call of Pripyat Complete, and more. If you want a challenging, atmospheric, IMMERSIVE game, I'd say that every S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game is going to be perfect for you.The downfalls of really each of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games is the lack of multiple weapons. There are only a good few weapons in the game, but getting the MISERY mod overhaul will definitely add several weapons to the game. The graphics (texture-wise) are pretty good for its time when the game came out. However, the lighting, especially for S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat, is PHENOMENAL. The lighting uses DirectX 11, to bring the most satisfying lighting effects for any game, maybe even for some next-gen console & PC games.To make this all short:Yes. Buy the game. This series has what some components of Fallout should've been. Once you play it, you'll see exactly what I mean.

Turn your lights off, your volume up, grab a bottle of vodka and get ready to become a hermit, because this game gets intense. With a wonderful combat system, an implemented RPG-like system (inventory control, some story focus), and some real scary ♥♥♥♥ thrown in, you'll play it a second time around and still get scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when you're trekking through the marsh when it's pitch black, you've used your last bandage, your flashlight battery is almost dead and you start to hear footsteps quickly chasing behind you. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat:S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is a sequel to S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow Of Chernobyl, but has very little to do with the prequel except for the gameplay similarities and that they both are located in ''The Zone'' which is the irradiated area  surrounding the nuclear power plant Chernobyl and the city of Pripyat in Ukraine, needless to say, other than that the whole scenario is fictional. S.T.A.L.K.E.R is a Horror/Survival FP Shooter game developed by GSC Game World.General Information and story:You start as an USS Major Degtyarev and you are sent in to ''The Zone'' to investigate a failed operation called ''Operation Fairway''. This operation was planned to take the the Chernobyl NPP by force from the current forces holding it known only by the name ''Monolith''. The operation was a failure and all the stingray helicopters crashed in a suspicious way. So there you  are and you're mission is clear, but as you advance in the story it gets everything but clear, the pilots that are dead or killed all died in an extraordinary way except for those who died by the impact of the crashing helicopter, and some of the helicopters appear to be disfuctional even before they hit the ground. You're mission is a solo effort to find out why Operation Fairway was a failure, but as you progress through The Zone you have to work among the local stalkers which are the people wondering around and exploring The Zone brought there by various reasons. You may choose to work alongside the stalkers or rob them as a bandit either way you will have buddies. Stalkers make the most money, which is a luxury in The Zone, by hunting Artifacts which are items formed in an anomalous area, after getting artifacts they sell them to traders who trade them to the outside world. Artifacts have strange abilities like healing abilities. The Zone is a strange and dangerous place which makes the majors mission anything but easy. The Zone is full of dangerous anomalies, radiation, bandits, madmen, criminals and even mutated animals and people!You're mission leads you to the center of The Zone to city of Pripyat where you meet up with the remaining soldiers from Operation Fairway, There you can choose to do something about the Monolith and soon find out more about how the helicopters crashed. As it turns out the monolith have a secret weapon which works with electric energy from artifacts and uses batteries for ''magazines'' the weapon is called Gauss Rifle and the helicopters were shot down. in the end you are given a option to leave The Zone or to find out more about the Gauss Rifle and the Monolith or about The Zone, so the story is only so good how mutch time you put in to it. Like any other game you can just rush it out or take time with it and S.T.A.L.K.E.R is one where you should totally invest some time otherwise it's easily looked over because of it's graphical issues and it's cheap look, but the truth is S.T.A.L.K.E.R is anything but cheap! It may lack a perfect story but the atmosphere and feel is like any other, S.T.A.L.K.E.R has many intersting side missions and stories and the fact that it loosely is related to reality and has a realistic feel to it makes it an unmatched expirience in this kind of genre. Gameplay:Gameplay of S.T.A.L.K.E.R is very unique in my oppinion, it combines FPS gameplay with survival elements such as hunger and radiation sickness and the need to sleep with horror and even RPG elements such as simple stats, different weapons and armor, economy, side missions and exploring. Combined with the enviroment the gameplay fits like a glove even if it has a few downsides. The downsides are mostly minor things such as repeated lines from NPC's and buggy animations, other than that it's O.K. All in all the gameplay is something quite different from other compareable games and in a good way! S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat can attract fans of many genres. Multiplayer is nothing special, you're typical DM, TDM witch areas from the singleplayer.Graphics:The game was first released in 2009 so the graphics are a bit old but i wouldn't say that they look terrible, they aren't the diamond either there is a lot of room for improvement in here but especially in the animations. The game uses the X-Ray engine and has been updated to version 1.6 with DirectX 11. The games graphics can be enhanced with several mods that are avaliable through the web. I haven't found any major problems that mods have not been able to fix.Other:One thing that must be said about Call Of Pripyat is the large quantity of different mods that are avaliable, apparently S.T.A.L.K.E.R fans are loyal to game and have made a lot of great mods for people to play. Allmost every problem and aspect of the game can be fixed/enhanced with large or small mods. I recommend playing the game with one major mod before declaring it a piece of trash.Verdict:S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is  allmost a ground breaking title. Call Of Pripyat lacks the appearence to catch peoples eyes but is a beautyful game in many aspects. S.T.A.L.K.E.R in my oppinion has no problems the mods can't fix. All in all it is a refreshing title and a great expirience for a fan of any genre and has a feel and atmosphere like any other. Story is nothing special but keeps you interested to the end plus S.T.A.L.K.E.R has many great side missions. You can easily put 40 to 50 hours to this game and still not have played every little bit, depending on your difficulty and playstyle of course. S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call of Pripyat is excellent singleplayer expirience!9/10

content:
y 9, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat could best be described as a mixture between Fallout, Metro 2033, and a touch of Mount and Blade. This game does not hold your hand, you are thrusted into the chaotic world of post-apocalyptic Russia with no tutorials or even goals given. It is easy enough to figure out how to follow the main quest, and side missions aren't revealed with an exclamation point over the quest-giver's head. The gunplay is surprisingly impressive as your weapons will break the more you shoot. Enemies are somewhat creative though they can become an annoyance as they are sometimes tough to shoot. But all in all, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is definitely worth a try.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
7, 2014
												If you like horror games, and you like RPG's, and you dabble in FPS, this is the game to get, hands down. Turn your lights off, your volume up, grab a bottle of vodka and get ready to become a hermit, because this game gets intense. While not your brain-numbing FPS like Call of Duty, where nothing really excites you any more because everything is an explosion, this takes a grittier, darker approach. With a wonderful combat system, an implemented RPG-like system (inventory control, some story focus), and some real scary ♥♥♥♥ thrown in, you'll play it a second time around and still get scared ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when you're trekking through the marsh when it's pitch black, you've used your last bandage, your flashlight battery is almost dead and you start to hear footsteps quickly chasing behind you. Don't miss out on this one, it is sure to provide a unique experience with an amazing atmosphere.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												Great game, nearly as good as the orginal game. It's been awhile since I've played the orignal but I only have fond memories of it. Playing 'Call of Pripyat' let me relive those great memories but in a new game. If you liked the orginal I can almost guarantee you'll be happy. Solid 4 out of 5 stars! I hope to see a remake of STALKER some day.Pros- Very much like the original (from what I can remember)- Challenging- Variety of "Shooters" to give you playing options- Shooting mechanics tweaked. I remember the original having an annoying problem of bullets flying too random and never straight.- Enemies do a good job of keeping you on your toes. Always loved the idea of psychic dogs- The survival aspects add to the game but are not overwhelming (Bleeding, eating, weight management, etc.)Cons- World is maybe a little small; could use a little more variety- More enemy variety- Why do zombies shoot so straight- More anomolies & artifacts- This is an older game so graphics are dated and somewhat kills the immersion. It's hard to believe that when playing the original I couldn't get over how good the graphics were- The same oddly shaped pink "diet sausage"...  could be Pro...?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
r 29, 2012
												This game is a jewel of the genre of apocalyptic games, and escpecially S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series. UI is practical and simple, storyline is very good (but wish it was longer), new graphics engine really brings the game to the table. And that atmosphere....This is why S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games have fans all around the world. The atmosphere in this game is simply amazing, it makes you want to put hundreds and hundreds of hours of gameplay even after you finish the game.Great thing is that this series has also a very big modding community, so it is always interesting to play. Be that a graphics/weather mods (i.e. Atmosfear 3), arsenal mods, overall improvment of the game (Complete mod), or global mods which create an entirely new storyline. There are easily a couple of hundred hours on this game. I would recommend it to everyone, especially people who like post-apocalyptic genre, realism, atmosphere, and simply a well made game. My rating: 15 out of 10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ber 26, 2014
												Unlike Clear Sky, CoP features all-new locations, which is one of its greatest strengths. It also features refined core mechanics, making it a true and worthy sequel to SoC in most ways. My only real criticism when comparing this to the other games in the series is the story. I won't post spoilers, but I felt as if the eerie and unsettling mystery that you unravel in the first game utterly trumps the story in CoP, and while the game certainly looks and plays better than SoC, the story falls quite flat by comparison. Which, given that (like the other games in the series) CoP doesn't hold your hand and other than the narrative there's not much to assist your sense of purpose in this open, desolate environment, means that I felt like I had less direction in this game than in both previous games. In saying that, it's a far more polished experience than Clear Sky, both in terms of the basic optimisation of the game and in terms of the game world. On top of that, the sound design is as fantastic as always (voice acting excepted), and the creatures are still ♥♥♥♥ing terrifying. So while I don't think this is the best game of the series, it is certainly my second favourite after SoC, and is absolutely a worthy sequel, and worth your time if you enjoyed any of the games before this one.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 23, 2014
												The third and last in the series (both by release date and chronologically), Call of Pripyat is by far the most polished vanilla game in the series. Unlike the prior two, in which a vanilla playthrough of the game was... bearable, while mods made them excellent, Call of Pripyats vanilla playthrough is perfectly fine, although mods still greatly improve the game. The story continues, and although starts a separate storyline (of sorts) it does tie in to Strelok's own storyline, and with that it indirectly ties in to that of Scar's. Much like the previous two, mods can absolutely change your experience with this game, whether you're just downloading mods to help optimize the game or change it completely, Call of Pripyat has far more complete overhaul style mods than the last two, almost turning it into a different game. Misery, for example, is probably one of if not the most well known of then, which turns Call of Pripyat into a hardcore survival game that will truly test you. This, again, not  only allows for a user to tailor the gameplay to their preference (and its performance to their rig), but also adds a ton of replayability.Much like the last two in the series it is excellent with tons of replayability and a great story to boot, worth every penny.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 27, 2014
												Fallout 3 has always been my favorite game of all time. If you're a fan of the recent fallout games then you will fall in love with Stalker Call of Pripyat. This game honestly blows me away (Litterally, in-game). The atmosphere is wonderfully eerie, especially at night.Pair this game with the Call of Pripyat Complete Mod and you will ejaculate on your keyboard while crapping your pants. The mod will enhance the atmosphere and gameplay greatly! Night time will actually be pitch black darkness and the only thing you'll see is the silhouette of the hills against the night sky. The only way of being aware of your surroundings is to crank up your volume and listen out for the horrors that might be lurking around you as you trek through this open world. Your flashlight is your best friend at night and can also be your enemy, as it will reveal what is in the total darkness and cause you to crap your pants. Night vision goggles/scopes are a huge help. After installing the mod, i never went back to the vanilla version, and it made this game into a horror game. It's hard to play the game at night (in-game) cause i found it wayyy to scary. I've played my fair share of horror games, but this was a little too much for me, thanks to the Complete ModFYI, the mod is PURELY a graphics mod. It visually enhances the game to add more "realism" and i highly recommend downloading it20/10!!!! This game is pure addrenaline and survival when paired with the Call of Pripyat Complete Mod! The Vanilla version would be a 10/10 for me. This game is amazing and needs to be put out there more. It's rare that games will forever leave an impression on me and this is one of those gamesGet this game, download that graphics mod, start up the game, and head over to the abandonded city of Pripyat at night. Prepare to Alt+F4 when you get there

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2013
												After spending more than a year playing the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games I finally completed the trilogy.  It took me so long, I think, because I was almost afraid to play the games sometimes.  Not in a scary game sort of way but in a I-never-want-this-to-end sort of way.  I didn't want to proceed until I felt I'd fully absorbed certain elements of the story.  The choices you are forced to make in the games are compelling and have had a lasting effect on me.  I'm am a little sad that the journey is over for now.CoP seemed to differ from the previous games in that it was a fair amount more approachable to newcomers.  The first two games were unforgiving and had a marginally tough learning curve.  GSC prettied up the HUD a little, which made managing your character less of a chore.  But the gameplay was still the awesome gameplay from the first two games and the story was just as compelling as SoC.I can't recommend these games enough.  Play them now.

content:
19
												This is aside of the Borderlands-series the only open world-game I really enjoyed and that didn't start to be boring after a certain amount of time. It manages to capture this postapocalyptic feeling in a much more realistic way than for example the Fallout series and the constant feel of danger. As, how the game puts it: Not the factions or the mutants are your true enemy here. The Zone itself is what truly wants to kill you, spit on your corpse and kick you out again. And this hostile environment is in no other game better captured than in the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series. Especially the beginning until you have your first "real" gear the zone will toy with you like your a dandelion seed in a hurricane. PROS:+ So far the perfect example of "hostile environment"+ Manages to convey the dullness and loneliness+ Gun play is good+ Incredible amounts of mods - recommend you to go to modDB since they should have most mods up there+ Due to being quite old it also runs on potatoes+ Graphics can be pushed with mods to look decent even nowadays, especially ATMOSF.E.A.R. - a weather mod does a tremendous job CONS:- Especially on higher difficulties (and with difficulty-increasing mods) very unforgiving- You will die a lot in the beginning as the game has the same concept of a "tutorial" as the Souls-series (none)- Nothing for those with problems with jump scares - not as much as the game does it on purpose, but you WILL sometimes just hear a mutant a split second before it is on top of you

content:
, 2013
												After spending more than a year playing the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games I finally completed the trilogy.  It took me so long, I think, because I was almost afraid to play the games sometimes.  Not in a scary game sort of way but in a I-never-want-this-to-end sort of way.  I didn't want to proceed until I felt I'd fully absorbed certain elements of the story.  The choices you are forced to make in the games are compelling and have had a lasting effect on me.  I'm am a little sad that the journey is over for now.CoP seemed to differ from the previous games in that it was a fair amount more approachable to newcomers.  The first two games were unforgiving and had a marginally tough learning curve.  GSC prettied up the HUD a little, which made managing your character less of a chore.  But the gameplay was still the awesome gameplay from the first two games and the story was just as compelling as SoC.I can't recommend these games enough.  Play them now.

content:
19
												This is aside of the Borderlands-series the only open world-game I really enjoyed and that didn't start to be boring after a certain amount of time. It manages to capture this postapocalyptic feeling in a much more realistic way than for example the Fallout series and the constant feel of danger. As, how the game puts it: Not the factions or the mutants are your true enemy here. The Zone itself is what truly wants to kill you, spit on your corpse and kick you out again. And this hostile environment is in no other game better captured than in the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series. Especially the beginning until you have your first "real" gear the zone will toy with you like your a dandelion seed in a hurricane. PROS:+ So far the perfect example of "hostile environment"+ Manages to convey the dullness and loneliness+ Gun play is good+ Incredible amounts of mods - recommend you to go to modDB since they should have most mods up there+ Due to being quite old it also runs on potatoes+ Graphics can be pushed with mods to look decent even nowadays, especially ATMOSF.E.A.R. - a weather mod does a tremendous job CONS:- Especially on higher difficulties (and with difficulty-increasing mods) very unforgiving- You will die a lot in the beginning as the game has the same concept of a "tutorial" as the Souls-series (none)- Nothing for those with problems with jump scares - not as much as the game does it on purpose, but you WILL sometimes just hear a mutant a split second before it is on top of you

content:
er 4, 2013
												When you're going into The Zone, you know that you might not come back.  But if you do, you might just get rich.In the utter wasteland of Chernobyl things are getting worse.  And strange.  Mutants and monsters roam, the very laws of physics bend and break and the sky rains death in erruptions.  In this horrible place dubbed "The Zone",  military, rogue and secret factions war  for the secrets the zone is hiding.  Secrets that could free or end the world.STALKER Call of Pripyat is the finest in freeroaming wasteland adventure.  The non-scripted nature of this game will feed you a constant stream of emergent storytelling.  Don't miss this game.Also, read the wonderful Russian short story this series is based on called "Roadside Picnic", which is a free download somewhere.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
4, 2011
												Do you like S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, but hate all the crashes, the inability to repair items, the wonky bugs, repetitive quests, the generally random-yet-static game world, unbalanced trade system, semi-useless factions, unintelligible story, confided customization system and the frequent loading screens? Call of Pripyat fixes all these problems admirably and delivers a far more focused and streamlined version of what is already my favorite PC game. While it's not quite as "Special" as the original, CoP is a superior game in almost every way when compared to its predecessor. The game is as stable as a brick house, the upgrade system is simple yet satisfying and worthwhile, the story is more involving and fleshed out, and while several quests do repeat, their only purpose is to fatten up your wallet which, thanks to the rebalanced economy, is entirely optional (no more 200000 RU Exoskeleton!). Furthermore, your actions really do seem to bring a measure of change to the Zone.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ber 27, 2015
												The third STALKER game finds itself as the first one I played the entire way through. The polish is actually there, the guns are much improved. Mission design isn't actually bugged and the game can be much easier than previous entries. I much prefer to recommend it to others over the first two, because it follows a more Bethesda-RPG path and is a bit more open world, with 3 major maps and 6 contained zones. The meeting areas in the ship, train-station and laundramat bring back the whole comfort in numbers/fear in solitude dynamic that Clear Sky messed up on.Though, the broken messes of the original's demise seemed to suck a bit of the STALKER magic from the game. Every location is played out on the map and seems to all share a purpose, some more obvious than others. I wish loners would populate some of these areas after the threat has cleared, it sometimes feels some of these were just left fortotten.Duty & Freedom find themselves with reduced numbers, with control only over Yanov, so the large scale fights feel very toned down. Even in the game's third act in Pripyat I was really expecting some sort of large scale battle, because the shootouts in Pyripyat in ShoC or the assault on the Freedom HQ led themselves to some of the highlights in prior games. X-8 played situational horror more than anthing more subtle in prior labs, or the huge army of monolith in X-19The graphics are stunning in a very bizarre game. Its 6 years old and I've yet to see more involving shadow effects. Some may be technically more subtle but none actually change the enviornment as much. The new Chimera can be one scary ♥♥♥♥♥ to find out in the open.Well the third act was lined with disappointments the endgame of actual freeroam is a haven to players who loved the RPG aspects over all else, and they included enough of a threat to not suck the fun out of the game.9/10

content:
30, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R. ranks easily in one of my favorite games of all time. It's an unstable, bug-laden, often-mistranslated with cheating AI piece of game, but god does it do something good.The ambience, the stress, the setting, the mechanics... Everything that makes an open-world survival game great, way before the recent survival craze on steam. The game is hard as balls by concept, and would have it no other way. If it reminds you of the Metro series, well, there's a good reason: much of the same people who worked for GSC Game World fo the Stalker series went to do Metro for 4A games. In a sad turn of events, GSC Game World screwed over its employees, and has basically died since this game has come out, so we might never see a S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game again.Call of Pripyat is arguably the best game in the series due to it relative stability and more mature gameplay mechanics, where Shadow of Chernobyl feels rough around the edges and Clear Sky is just instable and buggy as balls. The main character story was more interesting in Shadow, was utterly uninteresting in Clear Sky, and is mildly interesting this time around in CoP due to a few other characters,,,You like FPSes, survival games, getting out of here stalker, open-world games, russians swearing, looking at X-Ray engine crash dumps, and crouching in radioactive mud because you're being sniped at midnight by bandits? Buy this game. Now,

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
6, 2014
												By itself, Call of Pripyat is alright and mostly recommendable - way better than Clear Sky, but still far from delivering on the original promise of the STALKER concept. As all of them, CoP is genuinely at its best when you're left to roam freely, explore, scavenge, pick your own battles and soak in the atmosphere. The linear parts of the game are forgettable and the graphics, well, I guess there the engine is starting to show it's age. But it's pretty alright.However, the Misery mod for Call of Pripyat makes it an absolute hardcore survival masterpiece. It is by far the toughest, most fully-featured, and mercilessly dreary single-player survivor shooter out there - nothing comes even close. It always walks that fine line between jaw-droppingly challenging, frightening and just kind of stupidly insane, and that definitely makes it not everyone's cup of tea. The name doesn't lie - you can say a lot of things about Misery, but it's hard to call it "fun". It is a game out to murder you, both with bullets and monster claws, AND with its complex inventory/item/health/trade system which forces you to think about a lot more than just armor and bullets. Maintaining your health, stamina and the state of your gear isn't simply a matter of walking up to a couple of stations and spending some currency - oh no, this game throws one of the most arcane inventory/item/stats management systems out there at you while providing virtually no instructions, charts or stats bars, only vague indicators. For every new nifty acquisition there is a price - cheap food is radioactive, suits with gas masks constrain and muddy your vision, and carrying more than just bare necessities makes you constantly run out of stamina, even from just walking. It gives you few cues on who is friend and foe, and foes will drop you with deathly-accurate fire from long range. You will die. A lot. But in the process of making you miserable, Misery inspires not just respect and curiosity for the Zone (like STALKER games are wont to do), but sheer awe and terror of the place. It's a game that, many times, made me basically forget everything I was doing and RUN for my (virtual) life, as far as my realistically-puny stamina would allow - not through scripted setpieces like horror games do, but through sheer incidental immersion in the gameworld, which I knew at that moment just happened to be randomly trying to murder me. Even after many days of play, it repeatedly turned me into a lowly scavenger, hunting mutated pigs for something to eat, racing NPCs to a dead bodies just to get some loot off it before they cleaned it all up, and spending as much as 2 weeks of game-time just to scrounge up enough cash for a brand new gun that - gasp - actually works and doesn't jam all the damn time!So yeah, while I think Call of Pripyat by itself is just barely recommendable as an alright game, I give a very hearty recommendation to the Misery mod - with the warning that it takes a certain kind of masochistic player to properly enjoy its hatefully hardcore survival charm.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 31, 2013
 Originally posted on December 26, 2010 After being let down by Clear Sky's unfinished gameplay, I was wary of Call of Pripyat, and although the game is beginning to seem a bit dated, it is still tons of fun.Graphics-The game looks both technically artistically brilliant. While the engine is beginning to show its age outdoors at long distances, the lighting effects, foliage, clouds, and especially the decaying urban environments all look fantastic. I have only played the game maxed with DX10, so I can't attest to how great the DX11 features look. However, even so, the game looks and plays phenomenally.Sound-The music and atmospheric noises are as good as ever, and the voice acting is decent, which is good for a game from Ukraine.Gameplay-They've really integrated features that worked from Clear Sky with features from Shadow of Chernobyl. You can upgrade weapons and repair them, using special calibration tools (which are a bit too difficult to find), but ballistics feels much more like it did in the first, and the focus is much less on combat with humans and much more on exploring and finding mutants. Factions are in place, but no one will attack you on sight unless you've made an enemy of them. Even bandits. This makes for some interesting interactions out in the wild. There are now blowouts which require you to hide indoors or you will die. Gone is the wonky factional combat from clear sky, and perhaps most importantly, gone are the bugs, glitches, crashes, and other instability issues. That stability is what makes Call of Pripyat so refined.The story is weaker compared to the first, but it is still quite good, and the atmosphere of the game itself is great. If you liked STALKER, you won't be disappointed by Call of Pripyat. That being said, I'm expecting big things from STALKER 2. They've had plenty of time to refine their formula and train their skills. Now it's time to shine.

content:
4, 2015
												The last piece in the Stalker trilogy. The Zone is ever so dangerous, and emissions happen every now and then. In this final chapter the game isnt so different. Although the gameplay area is totally new consisting of three big maps (it is smaller than its predecessors, so the storyline is shorter), there are few other changes since the last game. Call of Pripyat is propably the most stable one of the three, which is a good thing.The Protagonist is part of a military investigation, but he is not considered enemy among other stalkers. The main storyline mission is about finding the remains of crashed military helicopters, and determing what happened to them. Of course there are lots of side missions, and places to visit just for laughs. The CNPP is not involved in the game, instead the final destination is the city of Pripyat.There are less mods made to this game, probably because it is the newest in the gameseries, but most of the mods are compatible with the steam version, and they will enhance the gameplay experience quite a bit.Definitely better than Clear Sky but cant compete with Shadow of Chernobyl.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 27, 2014
												Fallout 3 has always been my favorite game of all time. If you're a fan of the recent fallout games then you will fall in love with Stalker Call of Pripyat. This game honestly blows me away (Litterally, in-game). The atmosphere is wonderfully eerie, especially at night.Pair this game with the Call of Pripyat Complete Mod and you will ejaculate on your keyboard while crapping your pants. The mod will enhance the atmosphere and gameplay greatly! Night time will actually be pitch black darkness and the only thing you'll see is the silhouette of the hills against the night sky. The only way of being aware of your surroundings is to crank up your volume and listen out for the horrors that might be lurking around you as you trek through this open world. Your flashlight is your best friend at night and can also be your enemy, as it will reveal what is in the total darkness and cause you to crap your pants. Night vision goggles/scopes are a huge help. After installing the mod, i never went back to the vanilla version, and it made this game into a horror game. It's hard to play the game at night (in-game) cause i found it wayyy to scary. I've played my fair share of horror games, but this was a little too much for me, thanks to the Complete ModFYI, the mod is PURELY a graphics mod. It visually enhances the game to add more "realism" and i highly recommend downloading it20/10!!!! This game is pure addrenaline and survival when paired with the Call of Pripyat Complete Mod! The Vanilla version would be a 10/10 for me. This game is amazing and needs to be put out there more. It's rare that games will forever leave an impression on me and this is one of those gamesGet this game, download that graphics mod, start up the game, and head over to the abandonded city of Pripyat at night. Prepare to Alt+F4 when you get there

After installing the mod, i never went back to the vanilla version, and it made this game into a horror game. It's hard to play the game at night (in-game) cause i found it wayyy to scary. I've played my fair share of horror games, but this was a little too much for me, thanks to the Complete ModFYI, the mod is PURELY a graphics mod. It visually enhances the game to add more "realism" and i highly recommend downloading it20/10!!!! This game is pure addrenaline and survival when paired with the Call of Pripyat Complete Mod! The Vanilla version would be a 10/10 for me. This game is amazing and needs to be put out there more. It's rare that games will forever leave an impression on me and this is one of those gamesGet this game, download that graphics mod, start up the game, and head over to the abandonded city of Pripyat at night. Prepare to Alt+F4 when you get there

content:
9, 2014
												The STALKER series is notorious for being an amaziing immersive astmospheric mix of FPS, RPG and Horror. Call of Pripyat is by far the best in the series when it comes to guns and ccombat. Finding a gun you really like and being able to upgrade your weapon to how you want and putting your life and trust into one gun to help survive out in the harsh world of STALKER makes the atmosphere and immersion far beyond any FPS game has ever even came close to. The world of Pripyat makes for a great RPG and creepy atmoshere. Creeping around at night in the dark with all the horrible sounds going on around you makes you really appreciate a good atmosphere in a game and also that your gun is fully loaded and your reflexes are fast enough to be ready for what could be coming at your through the darkness at any moment. Open world and plenty of side quests and NPC to make for a great RPG and enough guns to keep you playing for hours. Although the story starts off pretty good, it ends pretty weak compared to Shadow of Chernobyl, which has an amazing story with 13 endings! DDo yourself a favor and buy the whole series and then download STALKER Complete for each game. These are bug fix mods and tweaks. They fix most if the major glitches and problems the vanilla games have. Also, check out LURK ffor Shadow Chernobyl and Misery for Call of Pripyat for the best possible way to play STALKER - Shadow of Chernoyble and STALKER Call of Pripyat.

content:
24, 2013
												STALKER is basically Fallout's perpetually-grim alcoholic Ukrainian cousin who happens to have an avid, borderline-obsessive interest in mutated animals and bloated psychic dwarfs clad in oversized robes. (Believe me, they're a lot more intimidating than you might believe!)Essentially, STALKER is a highly atmospheric FPS sandbox with a lot of survival mechanics (the need to eat, manage wounds and radiation sickness, etc.) that also includes some horror elements. (Although I believe the original - Shadow of Chernobyl - was focused on horror more than CoP is)Overall it can be a very tense experience. I would certainly recommend picking this up if you like shooters that go off the beaten track and have quite a unique world to explore, as Call of Pripyat has done exactly that!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ber 27, 2015
												The third STALKER game finds itself as the first one I played the entire way through. The polish is actually there, the guns are much improved. Mission design isn't actually bugged and the game can be much easier than previous entries. I much prefer to recommend it to others over the first two, because it follows a more Bethesda-RPG path and is a bit more open world, with 3 major maps and 6 contained zones. The meeting areas in the ship, train-station and laundramat bring back the whole comfort in numbers/fear in solitude dynamic that Clear Sky messed up on.Though, the broken messes of the original's demise seemed to suck a bit of the STALKER magic from the game. Every location is played out on the map and seems to all share a purpose, some more obvious than others. I wish loners would populate some of these areas after the threat has cleared, it sometimes feels some of these were just left fortotten.Duty & Freedom find themselves with reduced numbers, with control only over Yanov, so the large scale fights feel very toned down. Even in the game's third act in Pripyat I was really expecting some sort of large scale battle, because the shootouts in Pyripyat in ShoC or the assault on the Freedom HQ led themselves to some of the highlights in prior games. X-8 played situational horror more than anthing more subtle in prior labs, or the huge army of monolith in X-19The graphics are stunning in a very bizarre game. Its 6 years old and I've yet to see more involving shadow effects. Some may be technically more subtle but none actually change the enviornment as much. The new Chimera can be one scary ♥♥♥♥♥ to find out in the open.Well the third act was lined with disappointments the endgame of actual freeroam is a haven to players who loved the RPG aspects over all else, and they included enough of a threat to not suck the fun out of the game.9/10

content:
4, 2012
												STALKER is...well, it's very Russian. If hilarious accents, bad translations and a ruthless difficulty (for the first 3 hours) turns you off, this will not sit well with you. Otherwise, you will enjoy the open gameplay, the strange creatures, and the zone itself. The shooting is solid enough, and has a decent weapon customization system, all tended to by a man you must first liquor up before he'll preform any upgrades. This is a game designed for those who want challenge, and the freedom to go anywhere and do anything, without someone holding your hand constantly. Very nominally a survival-horror FPS, it's not all that scary; however, the atmosphere will suck you right in, if you'll let it. This is a good entry for folks new to the series - easier than the previous two, and much more user-friendly. I recommend it whole-heartedly. There is also a rather large mod scene that I would suggest folks look into (after the first playthrough, of course).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
4, 2011
												Do you like S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, but hate all the crashes, the inability to repair items, the wonky bugs, repetitive quests, the generally random-yet-static game world, unbalanced trade system, semi-useless factions, unintelligible story, confided customization system and the frequent loading screens? Call of Pripyat fixes all these problems admirably and delivers a far more focused and streamlined version of what is already my favorite PC game. While it's not quite as "Special" as the original, CoP is a superior game in almost every way when compared to its predecessor. The game is as stable as a brick house, the upgrade system is simple yet satisfying and worthwhile, the story is more involving and fleshed out, and while several quests do repeat, their only purpose is to fatten up your wallet which, thanks to the rebalanced economy, is entirely optional (no more 200000 RU Exoskeleton!). Furthermore, your actions really do seem to bring a measure of change to the Zone.

content:
, 2013
												After spending more than a year playing the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games I finally completed the trilogy.  It took me so long, I think, because I was almost afraid to play the games sometimes.  Not in a scary game sort of way but in a I-never-want-this-to-end sort of way.  I didn't want to proceed until I felt I'd fully absorbed certain elements of the story.  The choices you are forced to make in the games are compelling and have had a lasting effect on me.  I'm am a little sad that the journey is over for now.CoP seemed to differ from the previous games in that it was a fair amount more approachable to newcomers.  The first two games were unforgiving and had a marginally tough learning curve.  GSC prettied up the HUD a little, which made managing your character less of a chore.  But the gameplay was still the awesome gameplay from the first two games and the story was just as compelling as SoC.I can't recommend these games enough.  Play them now.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 30, 2013
												Like any Stalker game I started out confused and overwhelmed. I was not sure where to go or what to do exactly. After a short while I began to figure things out and was noticing nice changes from the previous games. The story this time around is much more coherent than the original. The missions are similar to the other Stalkers but they seem to guide you along better. The original game would give me missions and no map marker for them, or the marker would be wrong. That caused many frustrating hours. I played through the majority of the new missions without any problems at all. It was quite a relief.The inventory system has been overhauled. It is a much cleaner interface and your weapons and armor are upgradeable. Also there are onscreen notifications if your weapons or armor start to wear down. Unlike the first two games you are able to repair items in CoP. The health system functions the same way, with bleeding and ruptures. You can also find and use many artifacts that give you certain bonuses as well as a nice dose of radiation. Though the artifacts were not nearly as prevalent as they were in the first two games.A lot of the same enemies make their way back into this sequel but are deadlier. The most memorable occurrence was my first bloodsucker encounter. It actually grabbed a hold of me and began to drain my blood. A truly frightening experience when it is pitch dark and the creature moves around invisible.The Stalker series is definitely not for every one. It is dark, gritty, and can sometimes be anxiety inducing. Yet I would still recommend it to anyone interested in shooters with some rpg elements. Once you get over the sleight learning curve it is truly a satisfying experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 3, 2013
												Third part in the STALKER series. STALKER Call Of Pripyat brings out into the light Major Alexander Degtyarev.The protagonist is an agent for the Ukraine Security Service and his(your) task is to investigate the failure of the mission "Operation Fairway". You start undercover in a new area of The Zone and you're immediately sent into surviving since there is a long way until your first objective and safe area.The game picks up from where STALKER SoC left it and has improved graphics,map size and keeps all the changes Clear Sky had. In CoP the devs removed the quests for data required for upgrading your gear and they added tools that the mechanics can use(read the quests for instructions where to find them or Google it ). The user can easily explore and he can find hidden stashes no matter if they have or don't have the coords on his PDA.The game has only 3 huge areas with good quests, achievements, underground laboratories, new weapons and new information the military has left behind.It's your decision what to do with the information found and who do you want to help. At the end of the game the user encounters a familiar face that brings the knowlege of The Zone.Pros-Exoskeleton can now be upgraded and the user can run. ( later in the game )- Wonderful quests and new beautiful areas.- More nice stuff you don't want to miss- Work for what you want.Cons- Only 3 areas-Almost impossible to achieve good ending final mission being too hard.A true STALKER has no cons.I recommend that the user does all the quests for the full experience Call of Pripyat offers and I also recommend that you play this as vanilla for the best STALKER experience then you can mod it and have fun.Order of gameplay - STALKER CLEAR SKY -> STALKER SHADOW OF CHERNOBYL -> STALKER CALL OF PRIPYATOrder of appearance - STALKER SHADOW OF CHERNOBYL - STALKER CLEAR SKY - STALKER CALL OF PRIPYATWatch your back STALKER !
