content:
1, 2014
												Probably the best game in the series due to many improvements and bugs fixed. The game is amazing and the developers sure put their best into it and hopefully they can release another S.T.A.L.K.E.R game in the near future. Here are some pro's and con'sPROS:+The new eye candy such as DX11 and Tessellation+Advanced 10.1 support+New level of textures/lighting+Fantastic sense of place+Lots of tense exploration+Numerous improvements over the previous games+Some cool new enemies to take on+Still charming despite it's flaws+Great NPC interactions+Better side jobsCONS:-Some recycled props, but no where near as many as Clear Sky-Ever present Xray "stutter" is still here when entering a spawn area for the first time-Still taxing on older systems despite the leaps forward in stability and polish-The story takes too long to get interesting-Pripyat isn't as interesting as the surrounding wastes-Eating mechanic is tedious-Supplies are too available-Predictable encountersDepiste some stuff still being recycled from the older games its still pretty great. Buy this game you won't regret it.

content:
er 2, 2014
												I've replayed this game maybe 3 times now. It is a DAMNED good game in terms of creating a world that can really immerse you. Many times I've found myself wandering the Chernobyl wasteland and believing that I was actually in this depressing and dangerous world that STALKER has created. The graphics are dated (one of the first games to utilize dx11) but definitely not enough to take you out of that immersion. Some mods have added more graphical aspects that will immerse you even more so I recommend you look them up. The game itself runs pretty well and it does a superb job of setting up the atmosphere.For example, there are many decrepit buildings and sites that are riddled with strange and sometimes paranormal entities waiting to kill you, from zombies, bloodsuckers to "poltergeists" and even giant mutant things. This game will scare the ♥♥♥♥ out of you on many occasions. The world feels "alive" and many events happen as you pass it by (by alive I mean the ♥♥♥♥ out there waiting to kill you is palpable). This and the first STALKER really set the bar on how to make an immersive world using the nuclear disaster setting. You will find yourself replaying it after a while because the world is THAT interesting and many events can happen differently every playthrough. Pick it up on a sale, or buy it cause it really is that good of a game!

												Fun game. Pretty difficult (I'm playing on the second highest difficulty), but the "huh, that tactic doesn't work against mutated slavic hillbillies that can kill me telepathically; let's try again!" kind of difficult, rather than the "I will rip a small child in half if I have to do this quest again!" kind of difficult. It's pretty spooky, but not because of scripted jump scares- it's all about the atmosphere. How close was that mutated wolf-bear thing that just howled? What's up with all the gunshots? Was that thunder or- *neck bitten by vampire-cuddlefish thing* nope, those were footsteps. The story isn't really central to the game, but who cares about that when they're immersed in a three way player-vs-bandits-vs-mutants shootout in the middle of a radioactive anomaly field? No one!PS, I'm running this game on Windows 7 and it has some issues with lag and framerate drops; based on Youtube videos I've seen, it works better on XP.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 8, 2015
												Right from the get-go, it should be said that this is a different game from Stalker Shadow of Chernobyl. In Shadow of Chernobyl (SoC), the entire game had a sense of mystery about it, a kind of unanswered questions vibe. It was a question of surviving the endless horrors of the Zone, of loud rain and calamitous thunder at night, and of breathtaking sunrises in the morning, as one gazes out at the brooding wilderness. It also encompassed a sense of massive and epic scale, as the player struggles for mere survival while the Monolith elite jealously guard the entrance to the Sarcophagus while the Ukrainian Military pours in all their best fighters, special forces armed to the teeth and guarded from above by a fleet of Mi-24 Hinds, to force their way through. Unsettling screams and distant gunfire at night, beautiful blood-red sunrises in the barren hills near the Army Warehouses, the haunting soundtrack of Cordon filling one's ears as stalkers wander aimlessly through the irradiated meadows, vengeance, melancholy, fear, and grandeur. THAT is the essence of SoC. Call of Pripyat gives off a different atmosphere. From the moment the player spawns, as he gazes out over the beautifully rendered swamps of Zaton, one gets the sense of opportunity. The Zone has been tamed, and there's money to be made here. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it does somewhat lessen the more emotional experience of SoC. Soundtrack was good. Weapons were unique and fun each in their own way, with customization available for most (they weakened my dear Ots-14! Waaaaaaaaaaaaaah!). Armor was plentiful, with many choices to pick (although no Merc Suit or Skat 9M). Characters were well-rounded, combat worked like a charm, the missions were sometimes tedious but on the whole more varied than the original game. I also particularly enjoyed the Factional Strife which one could get involved in in Call of Pripyat. I only wish that SoC had it. Playing the Loners and Bandits off on one another, or eschewing both in favor of the shadowy information dealer Owl makes the game much more lively, with some high-stakes plays to heighten the standing of your favoured faction. It is a pity one could not join the Mercenaries under Hatchet (what a swell guy!). I also liked the very idea of working with a fellow whose trade is the bartering of information (a valuable commodity in a place such as this!). I enjoyed the fact that some of these missions helped give one a sense of the scope of the Mercenary activities in the Zone, for they are without a doubt the most secretive faction.  Apparently they have some influential friends/allies. On the downside, I did not enjoy the fact that each weapon needed to be repaired before selling- this made the game much more difficult, especially since one needed to buy certain items in order to progress in the game. On the whole a fantastic game- not quite SoC, but worthy in its' own right.9.9/10

content:
y 27, 2016
												Between the mods, the community (or crazies) that live and breath this game, and my own immutable curiousity of this title, I quickly realized that this was a solid purchase. I cant compare it to anything because nothing comes to mind. It feeels like a predecessor to Metro but I think that is only because they are both Russian. So thats not fair. But its precisely because it cant be easily grouped in with other games that you should buy it. Here are the mistakes I made that you should avoid. Do not immediately mod the game. It will be tempting. The All-In-One mod pack with AtmosFear 3 and Absolute Nature are just great. But without playing it vanilla first then you cant fully appreciate the mods. Dont spend your time making numerous saves because you arent sure what to sell and what to keep. Just go with it. Trust your gut. Move on. The game will be more fun. Also, pay attention to what people ssay. I lost focused during a few conversations fairly early on and I think I sold something that I needed to progress. Maybe I didnt. But I was stuck...somehow. And it was all because I got distracted by my GF yelling about something in the other room. It turned out to be a boy and now we are all very happy. I just wish she wouldnt distract me when Im trying to concentrate wheen its something she is perfectly capable of handling herself. The game is a classic. If you dont own it, get it. If you refuse to buy it get medicated and do not send me a friend request, ever.10/10 - would ignore a living room birth again

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
er 8, 2014
												Incredible atmosphere, challenging but not artificially difficult, impressive AI, and did I mention the atmosphere?The base game is great. The "Complete" mod is great for a first time player, and MISERY raises the immersion to levels where you are truly trying your best to survive in the Zone, hunting with your fellow STALKERs at the beginning to make your earnings by selling meat.There are few moments as memorable in gaming as my first contact with a controller, and this game will forever be remembered as one that did everything right, but appealed to too narrow an audience: players who like to take their time, get sucked into a world, and carefully plan their journey and reap their just rewards.

content:
y 27, 2016
												Between the mods, the community (or crazies) that live and breath this game, and my own immutable curiousity of this title, I quickly realized that this was a solid purchase. I cant compare it to anything because nothing comes to mind. It feeels like a predecessor to Metro but I think that is only because they are both Russian. So thats not fair. But its precisely because it cant be easily grouped in with other games that you should buy it. Here are the mistakes I made that you should avoid. Do not immediately mod the game. It will be tempting. The All-In-One mod pack with AtmosFear 3 and Absolute Nature are just great. But without playing it vanilla first then you cant fully appreciate the mods. Dont spend your time making numerous saves because you arent sure what to sell and what to keep. Just go with it. Trust your gut. Move on. The game will be more fun. Also, pay attention to what people ssay. I lost focused during a few conversations fairly early on and I think I sold something that I needed to progress. Maybe I didnt. But I was stuck...somehow. And it was all because I got distracted by my GF yelling about something in the other room. It turned out to be a boy and now we are all very happy. I just wish she wouldnt distract me when Im trying to concentrate wheen its something she is perfectly capable of handling herself. The game is a classic. If you dont own it, get it. If you refuse to buy it get medicated and do not send me a friend request, ever.10/10 - would ignore a living room birth again

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is a mystery to me. There are SO MANY problems with it, and yet I still enjoyed playing it. Is it a great game? NO. But is it a good game? MAYBE. I have seen other reviews claim CoP is a better, more challening Fallout, but this is simply not true.VISUALSEverything in this game is repetitive and ugly. I have seen multiple reviews, even professional ones, claim that the visuals in this game are great, and I absolutely do not see why! I am not talking about graphics, which are so obviously below standard it's not even worth criticism. No, I mean atmosphere and appearance. First, every area of the game has the same open fields, short hills, boring trees, bushes, and grass. There is nothing in the natural scene that is beautiful or scary (I even installed Atmosfear, which is a beautification mod). Every building is square and industrial, filled with empty, useless rooms. This, far and above, is awful to look at. CoP is FILLED with identical buildings! Second, the oft-cited tense and scary atmosphere is present, albeit rarely. Truly scary or tense moments are governed by the RNG and therefore often missing. One of the "strengths" of this game, similar to Skyrim, is how independent the world is. Monsters and NPCs will spawn semi-randomly and often collide with the player and each other. However, this also means that the chances a creature will appear in empty building #127 that you exploring is actually very rare. Often I navigated a creepy abandoned factory (they're all factories, remember?) at night, with only a flashlight to guide me, all the while expecting some monstrosity to come at me, and NOTHING HAPPENED. I would find my loot, and go back to the safe zone, yet again. Boring. The best creepy moments, were the scripted ones at the end of the game! (which were few)COMBATThe second thing this game is known for is the FPS combat. One positive element of the game is that almost any enemy can kill you all by itself. Supposedly, this means you have to be very cautious in any combat situation and fight tactically. In reality, combat is the simplest rinse-and-repeat affair I have seen in many other games. Human enemies are a great example. If you are within firing range they WILL hit you (apparently every fool in the zone is an expert marksman) and kill you in a few shots. So, what is the strategy to defeat them? Easy: 1) hide behind cover, 2) pop out and headshot him, 3) consume a medkit to recover any damage. THAT'S IT. These three steps are pretty much the same for every enemy in the game, except for one that can go invisible (which is actually EASIER to kill). Headshots do very high damage (as they should in any serious FPS), but the moronic AI just stands there and shoots like a British Redcoat, so there is nothing stopping you from dropping enemies like flies. I have put hundreds of hours into TF2, so a headshot on a non-human player is like shooting fish in a barrel for me. I have literally stood in an open field, without cover, and killed four human attackers (NOT zombies) all firing at me without dying. Then, I just popped a couple medkits and waltzed away.WEAPONS/ARMOR/ITEMS*SPOILERS: I mention the names of weapon items, so if you want to learn them on your own, skip this section. *SPOILERS*There are many weapons in this game, however, half of them are nearly identical, many of them are completely useless, and the good weapons are both rare, and hardly used. First, all pistols are useless and can be abandoned in the first ten minutes of the game once you kill a single human enemy and take his rifle. Second, the first three assault rifles that you have access to are nearly identical, and the most common one you come across, the AKM-74/2, is a superior weapon for more than half the game. You can attach a scope and a grenade launcher to it. The next best rifle that is encountered in the second area of the game, TRs 301, is the literal successor to the first one. It too can be upgraded with scope and grenade launcher. This or the SGI-5k, will serve you for the rest of the game. Finally, all you need after this is a shotgun and again, the second shotgun you will likely encounter, the SPSA-14, will serve you for more than half the game. I easily beat the entire game with this assault rifle and shotgun combo. I never needed another weapon. There are several stronger special weapons, but the big problem is, you don't have access to them until you reach the final level, which is something like 80% into the game! So you get these cool new weapons, and no time to use them. BOO.Another note about weapons/armor. You can upgrade your weapons with technicians in safe areas, however, you have to find tools to give them to get access to the higher tier upgrades. It was an absolutely STUPID choice to put the final-tier tools in the last area of the game! Also, there is absolutely NO HINT where they are located, so you just have to exhaustively search every building in the final area to find them. What does this mean? Well, first, you will encounter every major enemy in the third area and kill it BEFORE you get the tools! Therefore, you will have fully explored the final area of the game BEFORE you can upgrade your weapons to the highest level! What that hell good is that!? What good is the amazing targeting scope on my sniper rifle when I already killed the 12 enemy fighters in the apartment building BEFORE I got it!? This is even worse with the armor. The best armor in the game does not allow you to run while wearing it until you have the final tier upgrade for it. Once again, this armor is completely uselss for 90% of the game.MAP LEVELSThe final frustrating element of this game is the map itself. So many players completely overlook that this game is really just a walking simulator. There is NO transportation or fast travel in this game. YOU. WALK. EVERYWHERE. Or more accurately, you sprint, walk, sprint, walk, eat a sausage, sprint, walk, sprint, walk, everywhere! You spend SO MUCH time walking! It's enfuriating. This game is not like Fallout/Skyrim where interesting events happen to you while you travel. At best you may happen upon some humans fending off a mutant attack. Honestly, the best strategy here is just to watch, because usually the mutants kill the humans, and you can loot their bodies. Otherwise, there is no reason to waste hours walking. To make matters worse, because your primary source of money in the game are special items called artifacts that are located in the far corners of each map and that respawn at random every few days, you will do A LOT of backtracking. Furthermore, the map is divided into three levels that you can only travel between by use of a guide. This "guide" is basically fast travel, since you talk to him, pay him money, and then you are instantly transported to the next area. You CANNOT access the other areas of the game on foot. You must PAY a guide to take you EVERY time you want to change levels (which is a lot). The reason for this is so obvious: the developers needed to separate all of the assets in the game so it wouldn't completely overload our computers. Finally, the third level of the game, which is really your primary goal, is both small and extremely short. What should be a climactic final level, is over in a handful of quests.Honestly, there are so many other things I could complain about, but I still choose to recommend this game because you can pick it up for nearly nothing during a sale. This game barely registers in the positive for me at a 6/10, but if you have a couple extra bucks come the next big sale, you may want to give it a try just to see what all the fuss is about.

r 25, 2016
												They really need to make another STALKER. A head shot is actually a headshot. Full body armor but no helmet? Yeah, shoot them in the head. Drop like a sack of potatoes. Enemy AI is pretty cool as well. Actually had an enemy fire directly at me while his buddies tried to flank me instead of just coming straight at me. The accuracy of the weapons are spot on as well. Your bullets dont seem to fly in a straight line especially if you're spraying lead like most other games. Searching anomilies is dangerous but fun. Ran around an anomily while running from a snork just to watch it try to run through it and get torn to shreds. It's a pretty amazing game. I would love to see another one made. Bigger, better, and with just a few more weapon and armor options. Just as long as the core game play stays the same. Someone needs to get STALKER 2 rolling! It's been long enough!

content:
4, 2014
												Great open-world game. If you like Fallout 3, then consider the STALKER series Fallout on steroids. Combat is intense, against both humans and mutants alike, and a single headshot from an enemy is enough to take you out. You have an absurd amount of freedom in this game. If you want to shoot the guy giving you a mission, you can. If you want to shoot the guy who just rewarded you for completing a mission, you can. I've already been playing this game, CoP for about 15 hours and haven't even started with the mainline story missions, there's so much else you can do.Not to mention this game is so DYNAMIC. Enemies get into firefights if they're in opposing groups, or mutants against humans. Bandits and other stalkers will loot dead bodies after killing them. Wounded enemies can either be healed with one of your medkits or executed. Wild packs of mutants will kill human AI and drag their bodies off to be eaten. And anomolies don't discriminate against who they destroy. These are things that were in all of the STALKER games, mind you.If you do decide to get this game, be sure to download either the complete (better graphics, improved gameplay, bug fixes) or the Misery (same as Complete only a LOT harder) mods. They're a good pick for even a first time run through, though I would only do Misery if you are really patient and don't mind dying a lot.

content:
14
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is an amazing sequel to the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series!Soo get your Vodka and your Aks STALKER!After finish all the S.T.A.L.K.E.R games(with no mods) i certainly love Pripyat the most.- The story is quite decent and the ending is not bad but its not as good as Shadow of Chernobyl- Theres tons of new cool features like achivements, a better upgrade system, sleep mechanic, and many more!- The animation and graphic certainly looks better- There is only 3 areas you can explore but the areas are bigger and i don't really mind that, in fact its better then waiting for annoying loading everytime you want to go somewhere- The new areas looks awesome and much more realistic- The Side quest i think is the best thing in this game - Theres tons of abandoned buildings and anomaly caves to explore!- weapons and armor can be repair and upgraded!Overall S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call of Pripyat to me is the BEST S.T.A.L.K.E.R gameMainly because theres tons of exploration and awesome side questI also feel like CoP is the easiest S.T.A.L.K.E.R game that or maybe im too good :vThe S.T.A.L.K.E.R games is a very amazing series and very underated in my opinion I never felt such unique and amazing expirence with these gamesWith each S.T.A.L.K.E.R games has their own main focus Shadow of Chernobyl (Atmosphere/Story), Clear Sky (Combat), and Call of Pripyat (Exploration)S.T.A.L.K.E.R could be my Favorite game series of all time!Now i'm taking a break after the feeling of being scared in SoC, Constantly getting shoted in CS, and Wander aimlessly hoping to find something in CoPAll those times i drink vodka to cure radiation and getting aimboted by bandits was great ahh good timesAnd now to Play the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series again with MODS!

												buy this gameDownload the Misery modselect russian voices (everything except the russian voice acting is terrible)select dark road (or else the game just feels awkward)everything else change to your preferenceif you're not playing the game like this you aren't getting the full experienceIt really is not that hardMake sure that you have food on you (So you won't be panting every few seconds and plus you get hungry quite easily from hunger if you have picked the assaulter class)if you are going to get a stove to cook food make sure to get radiation drugs (you're mostly going to be using radiation drugs for this unless if you are always hunting for artifacts)REMEMBER TO UNBOX YOUR ARTIFACTS WITH YOUR "ARTFACT HANDLING TOOL" THIS REALLY SCREWED ME OVER AT THE START BECAUSE I DID NOT KNOW HOW TO SELL THEM, YOU HAVE TO DOUBLE CLICK OR RIGHT CLICK ON THE "ARTIFACT HANDLING TOOL" BUT MAKE SURE YOU DO IT BY A TRADER OR ELSE YOU WILL GET A TON OF RADSdon't be to scared of bloodsuckers they are only really a trouble in groups but a shotgun blast from the toz 34 to the head should do it (the easiest ones to kill are the swamp bloodsuckers because of how the water ripples you can see their movement), you want to be scared of chimera btw I also had an encounter with about 10 chimera when coming out of the Jupiter facility everything else good gameMISERY MOD OFFICIAL WEBSITE: http://www.miserymod.com/MISERY MOD MODDB DOWNLOAD: http://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-miseryMISERY MOD DOWNLOAD TUTORIAL:

er 19, 2015
												While an enjoyable game on its own, this game can support various mods to greatly expand its horizons. Suggested mods - 1.    MISERY - for its challenge and great amount of added content.2.    Call of Chernobyl - for all the locations added from each game, although quest content is low, there is still plenty to explore, collect, loot and shoot, with the mod creators updating it periodically. This is a freeplay mod, essentially.Both mods can be found on Moddb.Both of the above mods make the bloodsuckers almost always invisible when engaged, with no shimmer.This game does have some unintentional jump scares.The only drawbacks are the infrequent game crashes.I would recommend this game. One of the interesting parts of the game is just in exploring the underground labs and abandoned bases.

content:
r 30, 2014
												The STALKER* games are amazing. There is so much atmosphere. Imagine you are walking alone on a rainy night. Something is following you but you can't quite see it. You can sometimes hear it over the thunder and rain. Occasionally when there's lightening you see a silhouette on the ridge above you. You can't tell what it is. And you don't know if you have the firepower to kill it. So you keep moving towards your base. Glancing over your shoulder. Waiting for an attack that might not come. It's awesome. The weapons are great and the shooting mechanic feels incredible. It has a good story with many interesting locations. Highly recommended. *Shadow Over Chernobyl and Call of Pripyat are amazing. STALKER Clear Skies is just pretty good.
